data.title: Get what you pay
data.text: The room was what I would expect for the price. It was small, but comfy. It was clean. Had a fridge. Lacking in toilet paper, shampoo and Kleenex. If you can't sleep with noise do not stay here, it was a bad night for me, my husband could sleep through it all, but the hotel  is on the hwy and the cars never die, you are at a train junction right across the street and the trains run all night long. All the motels along there are cheap, that's why.

data.title: This is an older hotel
data.text: We had a difficult finding this place - there are 2 Roadway Inns, and we ended up at the other one first!  Our room was on the main floor, tucked back in a corner - VERY SMALL!  bathroom, VERY SMALL! There is extremely limited parking for regular vehicles, and no real parking for larger vehicles!  We ended up parking across the street in a parking lot for the Chamber of Commerce.  The Inn is a couple of blocks from several pubs, bars, and pizza restaurants.  Also, they charged me $4.00 cash for some reason and I never was told what it was for and I never got the money back.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear  miss_jl,

Thank you for taking the time to complete our survey and share your experience!  I am sorry to hear that you did not have a completely comfortable stay at our hotel we are now informed the management about your concerns regarding with your request which didn't grant your comfort and convenience are our top priorities.I do thank you for bringing this matter to our attention and I assure you that we are correcting this issue for improved convenience in future visits.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Aug trip
data.text: Hotel was ok.  The staff was great.  We stay here due to how close it is to everything.  Parking is a little tight for a truck. We had to park in the lot across the street.  The staff at the front desk were very helpful.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for sharing your review and giving us an honest look at the guest
experience in our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed the value and the convenient location of our hotel! We are delighted by your compliments, rating and review of our high housekeeping and hospitality standards. Your thorough review is greatly appreciated! We are so glad that your stay was enjoyable and we look forward to seeing you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not the greatest hotel to stay at.
data.text: The location of the hotel is in a great spot but that is the only thing on the plus side for the hotel. Very small parking lot. Weird smell when walking into the room. The floor was not vacuumed and the comforters had big stains all over them. The bathroom sink was not clean and there was hair all around it. If you want a hotel that is in a good location and close to downtown but don't care about how clean it is then this would be a good choice, but if you want great quality then I would not recommend this hotel.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your experience, and I am so sorry to learn that we failed to meet your expectations of quality service and accommodations. I apologize if you did not feel that our housekeeping met your own standards of cleanliness, though our own standards are very high and include checking up to ensure that rooms are as clean as can be. Your feedback will serve as encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services to provide an exceptional experience for you and other guests in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't stay!!!!!!
data.text: The lobby had a terrible Oder, no breakfast, and rooms were awful....... Save yourself and go down the road to the other roadway. Bed comforters were stained..... Busy intersection with very little parking.............rooms smelled terrible

data.title: Weekend Getaway
data.text: The woman at the desk and the cleaning staff were all very courteous. You can trust the photos on here from August 2015. This is a great place to stay for a night or weekend downtown. We usually travel on a budget and this is always our first choice because of the proximity to nightlife and local restaurants.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for leaving your five star rating of our hotel. It is great to hear from you and I am so glad that you enjoyed our staff courtesy and have taken the time to recognize the hospitality and care that we aim to provide for each and every guest. We're glad you had a great time with us and we look forward to serving you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place
data.text: Continuing a family visit, we stayed here one night before heading down to Phoenix. The hotel is older, but very well maintained. We were very comfortable I the room despite there being two adults and two kids. Convenient access to I40 and just up the street from gas and food. There are also some amazing sites to see around Flagstaff which makes the hotel ideally placed. For the price, I was pleasantly surprised. I would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for sharing your review and giving us an honest look at the guest
experience in our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed the value and the convenient location of our hotel! We seek to give each guest a very comfortable and accommodating experience and we are thrilled to hear of our success in this ambition. We look forward to serving you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Worst experience EVER!
data.text: My husband and I decided to stay a night in downtown Flagstaff.  We chose the Rodeway Inn because of the location.  After checking in, we were led down a creepy dark hallway to our room. After sliding the room key my husband had to nudge the door open using his shoulder.  The first thing we noticed in the room was the numerous stains on the comforter. Immediately after that, we noticed a BOOGER,  yes a booger on the wall! Shortly after the booger sighting  we notice hair in the sink. If that wasn't bad enough we noticed the lock on the door had been ripped off. I immediately sprinted to the front desk to get a refund and get the heck out of there. The woman refused to refund our money and moved us to another room. After arriving to our second room we were not able to sleep or get comfortable and the second room gave us the creeps. We left the motel in the middle of the night and drove home. Do yourself a favor and don't even consider staying here.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Please accept our sincerest apologies for the housekeeping issues that you encountered during your stay in our hotel. I assure you that each issue mentioned is being investigated and addressed and we thank you for taking the time to point out the areas where we can improve upon the guest experience. I do want you to know that we take guest comments very seriously and that all of the issues you've brought to our attention are being promptly addressed.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't stay here!!!
data.text: The rooms are small, smelly, outdated, we didn't even shower here , waited for the next day and hotel we were going to. Wouldn't give us a discount with our aarp cause she said the rooms were already booked, we were 4 families passing through on a road trip and had booked these rooms, rude , not worth 138.00, worth maybe 40.00 , the pictures on the Internet were not of this hotel as stated,other people looked upset too, it's on a nice side of town though, doesn't belong there.

data.title: Never again
data.text: Stayed here last weekend for my daughters wedding,  the price of the room was totally outrageous.  Room was so small you could almost touch the walls with outstretched arms. Parking was horrible,  lobby stunk of cooking smells and so did our clothes. Not even a hairdryer in the bathroom and the soap was nasty. Right across the street from the train station too the only reason we couldn't hear that noise was the air conditioner was so noisy. Bed uncomfortable and sheets were scratchy. This is a super economy motel charging way inflated prices just because they can. Very disappointed.

data.title: nice staff, but really not very clean
data.text: The staff is very nice, but the room was smelly and not well cleaned.   There was hair on the wall, and in the sink and shower.  Bad repair jobs make the place look really run down and our room smelled bad when we checked in, but the nice lady at the front sprayed some spray to help it smell better.  Very convenient to Amtrak, but grossly overpriced for what you get.   I would stay in a nicer place and take a cab or uber to the Train station next time.   But again the staff is really nice and it is walking distance to AmTrak.

data.title: Flagstaff beer fest
data.text: Room not clean. Sink dirty, coffee and grinds still in the coffee pot. Q-tips and Kleenex on the floor from previous guests. Bed was made but don't think the sheets were clean. Have stayed here previously and was not that bad. Not expecting opulence at this property but do expect clean. And rate way to high for this place, clean or not.

data.title: The smallest rooms in the world!!!
data.text: No parking, no pillows, rooms are so small 2 people cannot move around, bathroom sink is in the middle of the room below the tv!!, I wish I knew what was coming, no cancellation available,  u book it its yours , $160 per night, I could have stayed at motel 6 and got a better room, NE greeting when check in, just said where is your credit card ,and fill this out, never, ever, ever again will I stay here, u will be disappointed!!!!

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for reporting this incident you had in the hotel. We are already making reports about this so the management will be informed by this news. We are very sorry about your disappointment but rest assured, your concerns will be highly appreciated to better our services to our dear customers. We hope you can consider us again after the experience you had in us. We promise you a better service and a professional staff.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Do not stay here!!!!
data.text:
Please do yourself a favor and do not stay here (Downtown Roadway).  You will regret it.  It is not worth your money, Saturday was over $200.  The rooms are small, the bed slopes in the middle, and there is no hair conditioner. You get 3 small square pillows, with creaking floors you are most likely, annoying the people below. 

Checked in, and went to my room 118, the room was so small, the king size bed took up all of the room. There was only 1.5 foot between the wall / door and the bed. On that wall was the TV, so you had to be careful not to hit it.   

When I was looking over the room there was no hair conditioner in the bathroom, just 2 shampoo and 1 bar of soap...ALL on the floor of the bathroom.  The sink had no ledge that you could set anything on, and the shower soap holder was not constructed correctly, it tipped down, everything just rolled off of it.  I called the front desk, asking for a conditioner, knowing I would need some for my shower in the AM.  The front desk lady said there was none, the shampoo was both, I said it just says Shampoo on it not 2 in 1 shampoo and conditioner.   I asked again for some conditioner, I need it.  She said they don't have any.  I've NEVER checked into a hotel with out conditioner.  The lady was so rude about it too.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry to hear that you did not have a completely comfortable stay at our hotel we are now informed the management about your concerns regarding with your request which didn't grant your comfort and convenience are our top priorities.I do thank you for bringing this matter to our attention and I assure you that we are correcting this issue for improved convenience in future visits.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: worst yet
data.text: 1. had to pay utility charge of $4  a night we had a king size bed, tv frig and micro. but 2 people could not fit in bathroom .room by the bed what so small you felt like you needed to turn sideways  closet was really small. the only good thing the shower was large and water pressure was great never again high price also

Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. I do thank you for bringing this matter to our attention and I assure you that we are correcting this issue for improved convenience in future visits.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't stay here.
data.text: Don’t stay here. This hotel is on the corner of a busy train track, and a busy intersection, and is extremely noisy. We stayed in room 104, which had a broken toilet seat that pinched you if you sat on it, plywood for a window, stained linens, no smoke detector, no fire sprinklers, a bathroom door that didn’t close, and a front door that took two people to open and close. Our friends stayed in 116, and their children’s feet were black from walking on the filthy carpet, and they found a hairball in their bed. We selected the “pay at hotel” option through a travel site, and were overcharged for our room, and charged an additional fee that wouldn’t have been charged had we paid in advance through the travel site. We were repeatedly hung up on when we called to get the issue fixed. We had to contact the national chain to get our money back. Don’t stay here.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I do apologize for the disturbance of your rest, and we appreciate that you have let us know about this inconvenience. We strive hard to maintain a quiet and family friendly environment, but we can not control. In the future, please speak with our front desk staff if there is too much noise, and we will move you to a more quiet section of the hotel. We hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Staff are liars
data.text: Caution as there are several Rodeway Inn in Flagstaff, AZ (a couple of them are on the same street).  We booked Rodeway Inn through Priceline, and relied on GPS to get us there (it was late, we were tired).  At check-in, I gave the clerk my Priceline booking number.  The clerk (Sonia), didn't acknowledge anything and proceeded to charge my credit card for the full night.  I told her that I believe it is already pre-paid through Priceline.  She said "no".  As I didn't have my full receipt with me, it was late and we were tired, I allowed her to charge my credit card.  The room was horrible - smelled like mold, torn carpet, moldy bathroom, overnight guest fight etc.  The next morning, I was able to confirm that Priceline had also charged me for the reservation.  Turns out we inadvertently checked-in to the wrong Rodeway Inn (the other one is just 1 mile away on the same street on Route 66).  The clerk (Sonia) knowingly charged us even though the reservation wasn't at her location.  She led me to believe that I was checking in to the correct hotel.  Now we are left with 2 charges (1 for a pre-paid Priceline hotel that is non-refundable; and the other horrible stay we had at a hotel we didn't intend to book). The staff at this motel are liars.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am deeply saddened to know that you got disappointed with our staff. We already informed the management about this already as we see this a serious matter. We promise to be more careful soon as we believe that our customer's convenience are at the peak of our interest. In addition, we promise that these instances will never happen again. I hope you will still consider us for your stay again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: OMG!!
data.text: So my wife i and went to just visit flagstaff. Booked this room because it was in downtown flagstaff. First walking in, the whole lobby smelled like someone was cooking curry. My wife gagged and walked out. The lady at the front desk was dealing with a somwhat of a difficult guest, so it took a while just to get started.(had to sit in the smell) I  was feeling uncomfortable so i asked to see our room before we stayed. We walked in and it smelled like someone just peed on the floor. The whole room smelled like urin. I wanted to throw up. Dont get me wrong i wasnt expecting 5 star room but omg! That was gross. Needless to say i went to the lobby and cancelled. Had to pay 60 bucks. But i didnt care. Do not go!!!

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am very sorry to hear that you experienced such unusual circumstances and inconveniences during your visit with us, especially that we were not able to address the issues and misunderstandings right away. I want to assure you that we are thoroughly investigating this claim. The standard procedure in such cases is to confer with management regarding what can be done to resolve the error, as our staff is not authorized to make decisions which conflict with policy. We understand that you are hesitant to return based on this experience, though we hope to have another chance to impress you in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: GREAT LOCATION TO OLD TOWN
data.text:
We stayed at the Rodeway Inn one night as we drove through Flagstaff towards the Grand Canyon.  We were lucky to get the last room at the Inn, and fortunate in it being the back room - we had a very peaceful nights sleep, although I can imagine some of the front rooms being a little louder due to the Inn's location on Route 66.
Clean & well appointed, the room met our expectations.
The selling point for the Rodeway Inn should be it's proximity to Heritage Square and all the bars/restaurants in the area.
Coffee and Juices in the morning.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: It means a lot to us that you've taken the time to share this positive experience at our hotel. We seek to give each guest a very comfortable and accommodating experience and we are thrilled to hear of our success in this ambition. I can't begin to express how much it means to our management and staff to hear from guests like yourself who have found our accommodations and services to be so welcoming and convenient throughout the years. On behalf of our entire staff, we thank you for your business and we hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beware of sticky fingered housekeeping
data.text:
Stayed here with my sister over New Year's. I had reservations based on other reviews but took the chance because it was a good location within easy walking distance to downtown. You definitely get what you pay for, and when the rate is half as much as other nearby hotels, there is certainly a reason. I couldn't sleep first night because the train came by every 30 minutes. I'm not a light sleeper but the train is a stone's throw away and incredibly loud. Also woke up every time the heater came on- almost as loud as the train was.

We went skiing on New Year's Eve and made the mistake of leaving our purses in the room. When we came back in the afternoon, we saw that housekeeping had come through and realized our purses had been left in plain sight. My sister was almost certain $10 cash was missing from her wallet, but didn't have proof and nothing else appeared to be missing so we let it go. Two weeks later I saw that my registered Starbucks gift card had been used in Flagstaff while I was back home in Phoenix. I checked my wallet and sure enough my gift card was missing. Called my sister and she had also realized her Bed Bath and Beyond gift card had gone missing from her wallet (a gift from her recent wedding). 

Called Choice Hotels to report the missing items and request a credit for the amount taken. Was told that all their properties are franchised and that due to the nature of my claim it would need to be resolved by the property owner. The customer service agent took my information, submitted my complaint to the owner and told me they are obligated to reply within 72 hours. That time came and went with no response so I called Choice Hotels to follow up and was told again that their properties are franchised and the issue would need to be resolved by the property owner. No response received from the property owner, and no help in resolving the issue from Choice customer service. 

Trust the reviews, it is not worth the small amount that you save to stay here.

owner_response.author: Dipesh P, Guest Relations Manager at Rodeway Inn Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am very sorry to hear that you experienced such unusual circumstances and inconveniences during your visit with us, especially that we were not able to address the issues and misunderstandings right away. I want to assure you that we are thoroughly investigating this claim. The standard procedure in such cases is to confer with management regarding what can be done to resolve the error, as our staff is not authorized to make decisions which conflict with policy. We understand that you are hesitant to return based on this experience, though we hope to have another chance to impress you in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
